_header: Almighty God that all hath wrought
_description: An Invocation to the Creator — in couplets

BodAddA268.First Lines:
All myȝty god þat all has wroȝtHeuen & hell
                    & erth of noȝtWater & lond day & nyȝtSone &
                    mone to shyne bryȝt…
BodAddA268.Last Lines:
…þere we for syn arn fallen frooThurȝ Adam & Eue
                    also
BodAddA268.Note:
58 lines; ends imperfectly (with ‘Thurȝ Adam & Eue
                    also’), lacks 18 lines found in Cotton Caligula and is not followed by
                    ‘The XV signs of the Doomsday’ (The XV tokens telle y may) as in
                    Cotton Caligula. In Varnhagen’s edition of London,  British Library Cotton Caligula A.II this
                    poem is treated as a part of the ‘XV signs’.

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Almyȝty god þat all hath wroghtHeuen & helle &
                    erþe of noght…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…That we synnefull were fallen froThorow Adam synne & Eue
                    also
BlCottCalAII.Note: In this MS 28 couplets, treated as introduction to 3000.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Quindecim signa (f. 89, by scribe in upper margin); omitted as a
                    separate item from sixteenth-century list of contents, f. 1
BlCottCalAII.Editions:
Varnhagen,  Hermann. 
             “Zu mittelenglischen gedichten: IV-X.” 
             Anglia
         3 (1880): 59-67, 275-92, 415-25, 533-51: 543-4.

BLEge2810.First Lines: Ale myghty god þat alle hase wroghteHeuen helle & erth of noghte…
BLEge2810.Last Lines: …To lyue in sorw swynke & peyneAy tylle he come to erthe agayne
